content: mini axolotl tapestry pattern by craftyalinag this is a very quick and easy pattern that is great for beginners to tapestry crochet once finished you will have an adorable axolotl that could be used as anything from a coaster to miniature wall decor craftyalinag mini axolotl tapestry crochet pattern by craftyalinag project level intermediate finished 3 5 in 9 cm x 3 in 8 cm - without dowel measurements 3 5 in 9 cm x 3 5 in 9 cm - with dowel yarn i used loops and threads impeccable yarn but you can use any requirements yarn you want just keep in mind the size of the final project thin yarns will make a smaller tapestry thick yarns will make a bigger tapestry you need very small amounts of yarn so you could buy one skein of each color or you could use whatever scrap yarn you have available i used the yarn loops and threads impeccable 100% acrylic weight 4 yarn 285yd/127g per skein i used the colors soft rose less than 1 skein light pink rich orchid less than 1 skein dark pink black less than 1 skein black white less than skein white materials scissors yarn needle 4 5 mm crochet hook or whatever size your yarn needs short dowel can be cut to size gauge 13 single_crochet x 11 row = 3 square gauge is not important and it varies based on yarn and hook sizes abbreviations single_crochet - single_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch chain - chain mini axolotl tapestry craftyalinag page 2 pattern notes every stitch in this pattern unless indicated otherwise is single_crochet this pattern is written in us standard terminology please do not share sell or distribute this pattern you can sell the finished projects made with this pattern this crochet pattern uses tapestry crochet which may be new to beginner crocheters i do not have instructions on how to tapestry crochet but i found a good photo turorial by lilla bjorn crochet https //www lillabjorncrochet com/2016/07/how-to-do- tapestry-crochet-step-by-step html mini axolotl tapestry craftyalinag page 3 notes start by making a foundation chain with 14 chs turn and single_crochet in the 2nd stitch from the hook continue single_crochet to end of row this is row 1 continue to row 2 following the chart or written instructions each square in the grid represents 1 single_crochet stitch at the end of each row ch1 and turn when you finish row 11 don t fasten_off instead continue to the next page to add a border and dowel mini axolotl tapestry craftyalinag page 4 color abbreviations each of these stitches is a single_crochet the number in front of the letter tells how many stitches to make in that color w white white d rich orchid dark pink p soft rose pink b black black written instructions chain 14 and turn skip 1st chain row 1 13w ch1 and turn row 2 4w 5d 4w ch1 and turn row 3 3w 1d 5p 1d 3w ch1 and turn row
